item.title: ClickMouse(x, y: Integer; clickType: Integer) procedure not working?
item.dc:creator: @Echo3 Echo_
item.description:
@Echo3 wrote:

Don’t worry about that, it’s just an unused variable in SRL.

item.source: ClickMouse(x, y: Integer; clickType: Integer) procedure not working?

item.title: ClickMouse(x, y: Integer; clickType: Integer) procedure not working?
item.dc:creator: @Wyrmcabbage Wyrmcabbage
item.description:
@Wyrmcabbage wrote:

[quote=“Echo_, post:6, topic:386224”]Wow, can’t believe I made that mistake, I forgot the randomness parameters I tested this one out, so I am absolutely sure that it is correct.

[code=pascal]program Test;
{$i SRL/SRL.scar}

procedure OpenFirefoxHardway;
var
x, y: Integer;
begin
x := 641;
y := 741;
Mouse(x, y, 0, 0, True);
end;

begin
OpenFirefoxHardway;
end.[/code]

And most of the color tutorials you find for SCAR can be incorporated into your Simba scripts because they both use the same resource library for color functions.[/quote]

Oh, thanks! This is great

But what of this? :

item.source: ClickMouse(x, y: Integer; clickType: Integer) procedure not working?

item.title: ClickMouse(x, y: Integer; clickType: Integer) procedure not working?
item.dc:creator: @Echo3 Echo_
item.description:
@Echo3 wrote:

Wow, can’t believe I made that mistake, I forgot the randomness parameters I tested this one out, so I am absolutely sure that it is correct.

[code=pascal]program Test;
{$i SRL/SRL.scar}

procedure OpenFirefoxHardway;
var
x, y: Integer;
begin
x := 641;
y := 741;
Mouse(x, y, 0, 0, True);
end;

begin
OpenFirefoxHardway;
end.[/code]

And most of the color tutorials you find for SCAR can be incorporated into your Simba scripts because they both use the same resource library for color functions.

Read full topic
item.source: ClickMouse(x, y: Integer; clickType: Integer) procedure not working?

item.title: ClickMouse(x, y: Integer; clickType: Integer) procedure not working?
item.dc:creator: @Wyrmcabbage Wyrmcabbage
item.description:
@Wyrmcabbage wrote:

[quote=“Echo_, post:4, topic:386224”]“Mouse” is an SRL function, so you will have to download and import the library in order to use it. You can do so by going to view-extensions, and enabling the SRL feature. As for importing it into your script, just add this below the program line:

Some good color tutorials for Simba can be found on http://villavu.com/, there are a million different ways to find and use color in the ways that you want :D[/quote]
It seems that all the color tutorials are for SCAR =O

[Error] (11:20): Invalid number of parameters at line 10
Compiling failed.

SRL Enabled. Weird? I think the function is correct, but you’re missing a parameter. Thanks for all the help

Read full topic
item.source: ClickMouse(x, y: Integer; clickType: Integer) procedure not working?

item.title: ClickMouse(x, y: Integer; clickType: Integer) procedure not working?
item.dc:creator: @Echo3 Echo_
item.description:
@Echo3 wrote:

“Mouse” is an SRL function, so you will have to download and import the library in order to use it. You can do so by going to view-extensions, and enabling the SRL feature. As for importing it into your script, just add this below the program line:

Some good color tutorials for Simba can be found on http://villavu.com/, there are a million different ways to find and use color in the ways that you want

Read full topic
item.source: ClickMouse(x, y: Integer; clickType: Integer) procedure not working?

item.title: ClickMouse(x, y: Integer; clickType: Integer) procedure not working?
item.dc:creator: @Wyrmcabbage Wyrmcabbage
item.description:
@Wyrmcabbage wrote:

[quote=“Echo_, post:2, topic:386224”]Use this instead:

[code= pascal]program Test;

procedure OpenFirefoxHardway;
var
x, y: Integer;
begin
x := 641;
y := 741;

Mouse(x, y, True);
end;

begin
OpenFirefoxHardway;
end.[/code][/quote]

[Error] (11:3): Unknown identifier ‘Mouse’ at line 10
Compiling failed.

This is Simba, not SCAR, just in case you didn’t know that.

A side note, where are some good tutorials on Color detection in Simba?

Read full topic

item.source: ClickMouse(x, y: Integer; clickType: Integer) procedure not working?

item.title: ClickMouse(x, y: Integer; clickType: Integer) procedure not working?
item.dc:creator: @Wyrmcabbage Wyrmcabbage
item.description:
@Wyrmcabbage wrote:

My code:

[code=pascal]program test;
const
x = 641;
y = 741;

procedure openfirefoxhardway;
begin
ClickMouse(x, y, mouse_Left);

end;

begin
openfirefoxhardway;
end.
[/code]

I’ve tried ClickMouse(641, 741, 1);, ClickMouse(641, 741, mouse_Left);, and ClickMouse(x,y,2);, with x & y without the '.

It works when I do MoveMouse(), but ClickMouse doesn’t do anything.

Read full topic
